newsitem.title: GERMANY: DTB says to test staggered close-of-trade times.
newsitem.headline: DTB says to test staggered close-of-trade times.

text.p: The Deutsche Terminboerse (DTB) derivatives exchange said on Wednesday it planned to experiment with staggered close-of-trade times for futures and options contracts.
The test period will run from May 2 until May 16, the DTB said in a statement.
The DTB said trade in index products would close at 1500 GMT, while equity options would be divided into two groups and end trade at 1501 and 1502 GMT respectively.
For futures, the DTB plans closing times of 1525 GMT for government bill contracts, 1530 GMT for the Bobl contract and 1535 GMT for the Bund futures contract.
During the test period, after-hours trading will run until 1605 GMT, the DTB said.
